        public java.lang.String transactionId()
        Gets the transactionId. The unique identifier that is used to trace an entire request. If you omit this field, the service generates and sends a transaction ID as a response header of the request. In the case of an error, the transaction ID is set in the `trace` field of the response body. **Note:** To help with debugging logs, it is strongly recommended that you generate and supply a `Transaction-Id` with each request.

        the transactionId

      • limit

        public java.lang.Long limit()
        Gets the limit. The number of resources to retrieve. By default, list operations return the first 100 items. To retrieve a different set of items, use `limit` with `offset` to page through your available resources. **Usage:** If you have 20 rules, and you want to retrieve only the first 5 rules, use `../rules?account_id={account_id}&limit=5`.
        Returns:
        the limit

      • offset

        public java.lang.Long offset()
        Gets the offset. The number of resources to skip. By specifying `offset`, you retrieve a subset of resources that starts with the `offset` value. Use `offset` with `limit` to page through your available resources. **Usage:** If you have 100 rules, and you want to retrieve rules 26 through 50, use `../rules?account_id={account_id}&offset=25&limit=5`.
        Returns:
        the offset
